Name: University of Galway

Located in Galway,Ireland the university is home to about  international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Galway  is ranked 860th in Top Universities by QS World University Rankings. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually NaN years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of University of Galway  is around .For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Name: Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology
Overview: The Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology is a university located in Galway, Ireland. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programs for distance education students.The cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, are around 10,92,725 INR.Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology offers students scholarships, work-study, and various funding. These scholarships are based on merit and performance.Emolument reports that Logistics, Operations, and Purchasing specialists are the highest-paid Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology alumni and graduates, earning $84,000 annually. The university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.
Eligibility Overview: Ordinary Bachelor Degree (Level 7) and Higher Certificate (Level 6):All Higher Certificates (Level 6) and ab initio Bachelor degrees (Level 7) have a minimum Leaving Certificate entry requirement of Grade O6/H7 or better in five Leaving Certificate subjects, including Mathematics and English or Irish, with a minimum of 160 points. Bachelor's Degrees with Honours (Level 8):A Grade O6/H7 or above in six Leaving Certificate courses, including English or Irish and Mathematics, is the standard minimum entry requirement, two of which must be passed in higher-level papers at Grade H5 or higher.Click on this link-https://www.gmit.ie/study/apply-to-gmit/irisheu-students/cao-student/entry-requirements
Accommodation: Off-campus accommodation The average rent is 550 to 650 Euros/monthThe residence type includes studio apartments, 3 bedroom apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartmentsEach student apartment has a washer and dryer machine which ensures they don't have to pay extra for tokens for central laundry facilitiesMany of the student accommodation is located beside Corrib shopping center in the heart of Galway city

Name: Maynooth University
Overview: Maynooth University (MU) is a constituent of the National University of Ireland in Maynooth, County Kildare, located 25 km from Dublin, Ireland. The university has two connected northern and southern campuses. Maynooth University houses over 13,000 students and 900 staff from more than 20 different countries. The university offers 235 UG and PG level courses in its 26 departments and three faculties. The most popular courses are in streams such as Social Science, Humanities, and Natural Sciences. Several research universities fall under MU, including the Irish Climate Analysis and Research Units (ICARUS), Institute of Immunology, National Institute for Regional and Spatial Analysis, The Callan Institute, and the National Centre for Geocomputation. MU provides on-campus accommodations for full-time registered students in their five residences: The Courtyard Plaza, The Courtyard Apartment, The River Apartment, The Village Apartment, and The Rye Hall. Students can choose from over 100 student clubs and societies, such as rugby, badminton, tennis, surfing, canoeing, archery, and kayaking. Maynooth University has strong ties to the industry, including giants like Google, Microsoft, Facebook, IBM, Intel, HP, Coca-Cola, Cadbury, Goldman Sachs, L'oreal, and Unilever.The average annual tuition fee for undergraduate programs is about USD 13,700, and that for postgraduate programs is approximately USD 14,800. MU offers more than 60 scholarships for students seeking financial assistance, including the MU Entrance Scholarships, MU Sports Scholarships, and the Google Women Techmakers Undergraduate Scholar Award worth USD 1000.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: Indian Undergraduate Applicants' Eligibility Requirements Higher Secondary Grade 12 School Certificate  provided by the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) or Indian Cert of Secondary Education with a minimum overall score of 75% and an English score of 70%. (ICSE)All India Secondary School Certificate (Grade 12) or equivalent scoresAll other boards demand a 75% English scoreThe minimum age for students is 18 English Language Proficiency International students should submit one of the following English language proficiency test scores:   Indian Graduate Applicants' Eligibility Requirements Academic requirements: International graduates who want to enrol in postgraduate courses must have a bachelor's degree that is comparable to an Irish bachelor's degree. Indian graduates must score at least 55% in business degree programmes, and at least 60% in other graduate programmes English Language Proficiency International students should submit one of the following English language proficiency test scores:
Eli Table:
English Tests

Minimum Graduate Score

IELTS or equivalent6.5 bands overall
IELTS for business degrees6.5 bands with 6.0 in writing and reading components
IELTS for Global Health & Immunology7.0 bands with 7.0 in writing and 6.5 in other components
Placement: Students must submit a Placement Application Form to the placement office and attend weekly placement classes to be placed. Students are recruited by top companies such as Google, Accenture, Bank of Ireland, Cadbury, Citigroup, Coca-Cola, Facebook, Goldman Sachs, HSBC, IBM, Intel, JP Morgan Chase & Co, Loreal, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, Unilever, Zurich Financial Services, and many others after they complete their graduation.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation  Maynooth University offers on-campus housing for its students, with five distinct residences. Maynooth University has five residence options Courtyard Plaza, courtyard apartment, river apartment, village apartment, and The rye hallThe Residences are only for persons who can live alone without the support of other residents or outside helpApartment residents mirror the campus' diversity, so you may expect to live in an apartment among people of any gender (excluding minors), nationality or origin, age, and course or yearFamilies and children under the age of 17 are not permitted to live in halls of residenceFacilities:Microwave, oven, fridge, and kettle are all included in the fully equipped kitchenThe rooms include a dining room as well as a loungeAll flats have free WIFI On-campus housing link Off-Campus Accommodation Off-campus facilities include fully furnished apartments, with the average monthly rent between 500 and 600 EUR. Studio apartments, three-bedroom, four-bedroom, and communal apartments are among the residential typesParking, central heating, cable television, a washing machine, dishwasher, and a microwave are all included in the student housingMany shared residences have room-by-room rentals Off-campus housing link

Name: Trinity College Dublin, the University of Dublin
Overview: Founded in 1592, Trinity College Dublin is one of the oldest institutes in Ireland. Trinity College has over 18,000 students from more than 122 countries and offers over 600 undergraduate, postgraduate, short courses, and online programs. The college is highly acclaimed for its Law, Literature and Humanities, health sciences, and STEM programs.Trinity College Dublin has a competitive acceptance rate of 34% and accepts applications through the online application portal, with an application fee of 55 EUR. Academic transcripts, IELTS/TOEFL scores, Letters of Recommendation, and course-specific CV/resume must also be submitted. The college is spread across 51 acres and is known for its Georgian architecture, museums, art galleries, and theatres.With more than 6 million printed volumes, Trinity Library is the most extensive library in Ireland. Trinity College also houses the institute's Business School, Science Gallery, the Long Room Hub Institute for Arts and Humanities, The Lir Academy for Dramatic Art, the nanoscience research center (CRANN), and the Biomedical Sciences Institute. The annual tuition fee ranges from USD 28,000 to 56,000.There are many options for availing of financial aid, some of which are the Global Business Scholarship and Postgraduate Research Scholarship. The government of Ireland Scholarship offers a 100% tuition fee waiver. Students can seek accommodation at The Trinity Hall with a capacity of over 1,000 students in shared, single, or twin apartments or at Kavanagh Court and Binary Hub.The average price of rooms is USD 205 per week. The average annual cost of living can be up to USD 13,800. Trinity College students can choose from over 170 societies and sports clubs, including hockey, rowing, investing, advocacy, animation, and zoology. Trinity College has a more than 92% employment rate. With its location in Ireland's Silicon Valley, Trinity College students find employment opportunities from companies such as Google, Facebook, Microsoft, PayPal, LinkedIn, Airbnb, and eBay.
Eligibility Overview: All applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English. The following qualifications are accepted/permitted: 1 Irish Leaving Certificate: an ordinary level English mark of 6 or better. 2 GCSE: English Language with a C or above. 3 US High School: English grade of C in senior year.6.5 on the IELTS (academic version) (no individual band below 6)IELTS (academic version) 7 (no individual band below 7) for dental coursesIELTS (academic version) 7 for Clinical Speech and Language Studies (no individual band below 7) A minimum score of 63on the Pearson Test of English (Academic) - PTE Academic (with no Communication Skills section score below 59) is requiredEnglish A1, A2, or B: 5 at Higher Level in the International Baccalaureate (4 at Standard Level if presenting IB through English)
Accommodation: On-campus housing is located in the heart of the city, in either historic buildings in the centre of the university or more modern structures further east. Trinity's historic campus offers students a one-of-a-kind and unforgettable housing experience in the magnificent surroundings of the 400-year-old universityfor more detail click on this llink-https://www.tcd.ie/accommodation/on-campus/

Name: EDUCO- Technological University Dublin
Overview: Technological University Dublin is Ireland's first technological university, formed by amalgamating three existing institutes of technology in the Dublin area, namely Dublin Institute of Technology, the Institute of Technology, Blanchardstown, and the Institute of Technology, Tallaght. The university has five main campuses in Grangegorman, Aungier Street, Bolton Street, Blanchardstown, and Tallaght in the greater Dublin area. The five campuses house over 70 student-run societies and 40 student clubs, including Gaelic Athletic Association, football, Handball, powerlifting, archery, rowing, skiing, basketball, kite surfing, and cricket. With over 28,500 students and 3,000 staff, the university has five colleges, associated schools, and several research institutes and centers emphasizing computer science and STEM subjects. Popular courses include Product Design, Mechanical Engineering, Architecture, Engineering, Science, Marketing, Hospitality, Music, Optometry, Pharmaceuticals, Construction, Digital Media, and Journalism.The TU Dublin Career Development Centre helps students secure employment from top companies, including Accenture, Ernst and Young, Deloitte, Microsoft, Google, and Amazon.Student accommodation options in the university include; living with a host family, staying in a student accommodation hub, or renting private accommodation, with the help of TU Dublin StudentPad. The annual cost of living can be up to EUR 12,000. The annual tuition fee can range from EUR 10,000 to EUR 12,500. Students can avail of various scholarships for financial aid, including the Government of Ireland Scholarships and the Centenary Scholarships for International Students.
Eli Table:
QualificationMinimum Grade

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

HSC XII

 

Standard XI will not meet TU Dublin's minimum requirements. Applicants with these qualifications must complete a recognized Foundation program. 

Successful completion of HSC XII

  • HSC XII: CBSE, ICSE, Kolkata or Tamil Nadu boards with an overall average of 70% or above.
  • HSC XII: West Bengal board with an overall average of 58% or above.
  • HSC XII: Maharashtra or Gujarat boards with an overall average of 75% or above.
  • HSC XII: All other state boards with an overall average of 80%+ or above

or

Successful completion of Standard XI with 55% OR successful completion of Standard XII 50% plus successful completion of TU Dublin Foundation or another recognised pre-university foundation with relevant subjects and 60% - 65%

or

Successful completion of 1 year of an Indian degree with an average of 55% with relevant subjects at a recognised third-level or higher education institution in addition to completion of senior high school. This assessment will be on a case-by-case basis.

Additional Requirements

  • Where Maths is required for a specific degree programme, a minimum grade of 75% is required in Maths, 80% is required for Engineering/Computing/Science programme.
  • Where a Lab Science subject is required for a specific degree programme, a minimum grade of 80% is required in a Lab Science subject
Placement: Work placement is an essential component of TU Dublin's higher education programs. It provides students with the opportunity to apply what they have learned, continue to develop new practice-based skills, and gain an awareness of what is expected of them in the profession, in our opinion.Employers benefit from chances to create research partnerships, recruit graduates, and collaborate with a Higher Education Institute on knowledge transfer and the creation of employable graduates.Work placement is a three-way collaboration between the company, the higher education institution, and the student. It allows companies to find a valuable source of competent labor for their company or organization and a pipeline for future recruitment needs.

Name: University College Cork
Overview: Founded in 1845, the University College Cork is a leading research institute situated in Cork, Ireland. It comprises seven faculties (Commerce, Engineering, Arts and Celtic Studies, Medicine, Science, Law, Food Science and Technology) in 4 colleges- College of Business and Law; College of Arts, Celtic Studies and Social Sciences; College of Medicine and Health; College of Science, Engineering and Food Science. With more than 21,000 students, the university is spread across 42 acres having state-of-the-art buildings like Alfred O'Rahilly, Cavanagh Pharmacy, Brookfield Health Science Center, Bio Green Café, Lewis Glucksman Gallery, Boole Library, and many more. There are over 50 active sports clubs and 100+ societies in gaming, political, social, religious, martial arts, water-sports, and other athletic games. The eligibility criteria for admission to University College Cork are based on scores in IELTS (6.5 and above), TOEFL (90 and above), PTE (63 and above), along with an admission fee of 50 EUR. Students can enroll in around 70 undergraduate and several postgraduate programs at an average tuition charge of 16,000 EUR- 22,000 EUR and 14,000 EUR- 20,000 EUR, respectively. The university provides financial aid up to 100% tuition fee to international students as loans, bursaries, scholarships like CACSSS Excellence Scholarship, SEFS Postgraduate and Undergraduate Scholarship, Quercus Masters Scholarship for all disciplines, etc. more. Campus Accommodation UCC DAC provides six on-campus residential complexes- Victoria Lodge, University Hall, Mardyke Hall, Victoria Mills, Castlewhite Apartments, and Aras Ui Thuama for students with a booking deposit of 300 EUR. With average staying expenses of 6,100 EUR, you will have Single, En Suite, Twin, and Single Ensuite room options. These charges include a fitted kitchen, TV, internet connection, laundry, wardrobe, enclosed parking area, and other facilities. With a 90% employment rate, graduates from University College Cork get placed with an average package of 71,000 USD- 90,000 USD.

Accommodation: The university provides a comfortable and safe place for students who wants to study here. The university makes sure that the environment is inclusive and friendly for one and all.https://www.ucc.ie/en/accommodation/
Course Description: University College Cork is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University College Cork was founded in 1845. Located in Cork,Ireland the university is home to about 3900 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University College Cork is ranked 303th in Top Universities by QS Rankings. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 4 undergraduate and 3 postgraduate programs. University College Cork has 5 intakes in Aug, Jan,May, Mar,Sep. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of University College Cork is around €2000-€15000 approx.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University College Cork include Centenary Scholarship Msc Marketing,Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University ,Doris Dixon Scholarship,University Of Calgary International Entrance Award.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University College Cork is the post-study work opportunities in Ireland. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University College Cork has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.
Overview_enhanced:
.

Founded in 1845, the University College Cork (UCC) is a renowned research institute located in Cork, Ireland. Spanning across 42 acres, UCC houses seven faculties (Commerce, Engineering, Arts and Celtic Studies, Medicine, Science, Law and Food Science & Technology) under four colleges - College of Business and Law; College of Arts, Celtic Studies and Social Sciences; College of Medicine and Health; College of Science, Engineering and Food Science. With over 21,000

Name: Griffith College - Dublin
Overview: Established in 1974, Griffith College is a third-level private educational institute in Dublin, Ireland. All three campuses- Dublin (main campus), Cork, and Limerick have high-tech infrastructures.The significant faculties at Griffith College are the Faculty of Journalism and Media Communications, Faculty of Teaching and Learning, Faculty of Design, Faculty of Business, Faculty of Engineering, Faculty of Professional Accountancy, Faculty of Law, Faculty of Lifelong Learning, Faculty of Music and Multimedia, Faculty of Pharmaceutical Science, Faculty of Professional Law, Faculty of Counselling & Psychotherapy, Faculty of Computing.More than 7,400 students are enrolled in 190+ undergraduate, postgraduate, international, professional, and short-term courses with part-time, full-time, blended, and online learning options. Students with IELTS and TOEFL certifications can fill out the online application form with an Academic Administration fee of 250 EUR.The tuition fee for postgraduate and undergraduate courses is 14,000 EUR and 12,000 EUR, respectively. Along with an application fee of 300 EUR, the average per night charges are 23- 46 EUR. Off-campus accommodation is available at an average monthly rent of 500- 700 EUR. The college also offers two types of financial support: Griffith College Dublin Bursary and Academic Merit Scholarship to international students. Griffith College provides placement assistance to students who can back an annual salary of 45,000- 65,000 USD.
Eligibility Overview: English Language RequirementsInternational applicants must meet English language standards.If you have completed previous studies in a language other than English, you may be required to take an English language test to indicate that you have met the English language requirements for your degree.You may be exempt if you have already studied in English. As part of your application, your eligibility will be evaluated.Check here for more details: https://www.griffith.edu.au/apply/international/understanding-entry-requirements#:~:text=English%20language%20requirements%20apply%20to,English%20you%20may%20be%20exempt.
Accommodation: Housing at GriffithOn a lovely 7-acre site in the heart of Dublin city, Griffith College Halls of Residence (GHR) provides students with a safe, secure, and private living place. Built in 2004, this purpose-built environment provides a comfortable and convenient lodging choice, especially for people who live outside of the capital.Our 24/7 security crew patrols the campus on a regular basis and is available to assist any GHR resident who requires assistance at any time.In the Dublin rental market, GHR is also relatively affordable. All costs are included in our fee, including water, electricity, heating, and Wi-Fi, subject to a fair usage policy.Check: https://www.griffith.ie/offices/accommodation
